TopicTitle: HELP: not possible to store my experiments in my lander...

Articles.Content:
After successful landing and data collect on EVE, I got this stupid message when going back on board:

"Your experiments cannot be stored on that MK1 Lander can"

Are there particular landers for a Kerbal to bring back experiments to Kerbin ?

See the story there:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69998-Succesfull-landing-on-EVE?p=977670&posted=1#post977670
Maybe there's another experiment of the same type already stored.
Yes that's it. I was stressed with that Eve mission.

I suggest you first, to do and transmit repeatable experiments like termometer until they don't give science anymore if transmitted (you will notice that some of them could provide more science only if returned).

Store them and run un-repeatable experiments, like Goo, and store them.

There's no need to store multiple reports for each experiment in the same condition, because, if returned, you'll gain the full science value.

Crew report is an exception, but can be transmitted for 100% of it's value in a single transmission, so it's not a big problem.
